case_title: NISAR AHMAD KIANI vs AZAD GOVERNMENT OF THE STATE OF JAMMU AND KASHMIR And Another
court: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Service Tribunal
respondant: Azad Government of the State of Jammu and Kashmir
complaint_summary: The appellant challenged his retirement order issued by the government following allegations of corruption, forgery, and misconduct under the Efficiency & Discipline Rules, 1977.
investigation_summary: The Vigilance Commission conducted a preliminary inquiry into the appellant's alleged misconduct in the Electricity Operation Division, Kotli. Evidence included forged documents, fraudulent account operations, and irregular procurement practices.
judgment_summary: The tribunal dismissed the appeal, finding sufficient evidence of forgery, corruption, and procedural violations. The appellant's objections regarding procedural irregularities and lack of evidence were rejected.
legal_arguments: Violation of Rule 6(5) of Efficiency & Discipline Rules, 1977 regarding inquiry officer's rank.
Non-compliance with Rule 8 requiring a show-cause notice.
Examination of witnesses in absence of the appellant.
assets: Forged Account No.158 in United Bank Limited
statutes: Azad Kashmir Penal Code (Act XLV of 1860)

witness_statement.Sultan Room: Denied supplying materials or receiving payments.
witness_statement.Javed Akhtar: Admitted involvement in fictitious purchases and fraudulent transactions.

maxims.Nemo debet esse judex in propria causa: No one should be a judge in their own cause.

legal_terms.Efficiency & Discipline Rules: Rules governing conduct and disciplinary actions for government employees.

words_and_phrases.Judicial Proceedings: Proceedings deemed judicial under specific legal provisions.

summary_vector_notes: The case involved allegations of corruption and forgery against Nisar Ahmad Kiani, leading to his retirement from service. The tribunal upheld the government's decision, citing sufficient evidence of misconduct and procedural violations.

key_issues_details.charge_sheet: Issued by Secretary Services vide No. Works/2366/82 dated 29-6-1982

appellant_objections: Secretary Works was a member of Vigilance Commission and could not act as authorized officer.
Inquiry Officer was not senior in rank to the appellant, violating Rule 6(5) of Efficiency & Discipline Rules, 1977.
Show-cause notice under Rule 8 was not served.
Mandatory provisions of Rule 8 were not complied with.
Lack of confidence expressed in Inquiry Officer.
Witnesses examined in absence of appellant.
Defense witness Tariq Mahmood was not summoned.
respondent_defense: Secretary Works acted in official capacity without personal interest.
Appellant was charge-sheeted as Executive Engineer, not as Superintending Engineer.
Oath not required under Efficiency & Discipline Rules, 1977.
Opportunity of hearing was provided to appellant.
Inquiry Officer not bound to summon all defense witnesses.
Evidence recorded in absence of appellant was due to his negligence.

charges.charge_1: Forgery related to fraudulent operation of Account No. 158 in United Bank Limited.
charges.charge_2: Payment of 7 bills to Sultan Room Contractor, involving forgery and fictitious transactions.

findings.charge_1: Proved - Forgery and fraudulent operation of Account No. 158.
findings.charge_2: Proved - Fictitious transactions and forged documents.
findings.charge_d: Not established - No evidence of embezzlement.
findings.charge_f: Dropped - No evidence of past conduct.

decision.reasoning: Documentary evidence and circumstances proved allegations. No extenuating circumstances to award lesser penalty.
